Bodily Injury
	
Personal bodily injuries resulting in an Insured Person 
suffering permanent physical or mental impairment in 
performance (disability) exclusively and directly as a result 
of Kidnapping, Extortion, Hijacking or False Imprisonment. 
The disability must occur within one year of the Insured 
Event and be confirmed in writing by an independent 
qualified doctor and asserted within fifteen months of the 
Insured Event.

a capital sum. The benefit for personal injuries is limited

Subsidiary
	
A subsidiary is any limited company, partnership or other 
organizational structure over which the Policy Holder has 
either direct or indirect control as a result of:
	
a)	
over 50% of voting rights or such voting rights as 
enable the Policy Holder to exercise control over the 
company or
	
b)	
the right to appoint or remove the majority of 
members of the administrative, supervisory or 
managing body, or
	
c)	
a controlling influence, for example due to a 
domination agreement or as the result of a provision 
in the articles.

title: 10.	 Special Provisions
sample_text:
If stated as included in the Certificate, the following 
additional Special Provisions apply to this Policy, subject 
to the other terms, conditions, exclusions and limitations 
of the Policy.
Loss of Hire
	
Loss of Hire means the loss resulting from the inability 
of the Policy Holder to use the Insured Vessel by reason 
of its hijacking, being continuing costs which the Policy 
Holder is obliged to pay for hiring a vessel even though 
the vessel is detained or charter revenues lost as a result 
of the detention.
	
If Special Provision 10.1 applies, Loss of Hire is an Insured 
Loss and the In

Redressal Cell at any of our branches with the details of your 
grievance during our working hours from Monday to Friday.
